Jack-
Not sure why I seem to be the only one responding here but FWIW;

	I believe that there was indeed protection for the armpit incorporated 
in Japanese armour, and as early as the eleventh century. The kyubi no 
ita and sendan no ita were plates of armour attached to the front of 
the oyoroi that covered the armpits when the wearer raised his arms to 
fire his bow.
	For me I guess the question is why were they fazed out in the 
Muromachi period?
-t
